cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 70 miles SSE of Savannah, Georgia
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing north then turning north-northeast along the southeast U.S. Atlantic coast toward South Carolina and southern North Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or over the South Carolina coast (around Charleston area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch north of Surf City NC to Cape Lookout NC (Atlantic side)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning north of Fernandina Beach FL to Surf City NC; Tropical Storm Warning north of Flagler/Volusia County line FL to Duck NC including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Volusia/Brevard FL line northward along the Georgia, South Carolina and North Carolina coasts to Cape Fear NC
weather_observation.wind: Only low-end tropical-storm-force gusts are possible; probability of sustained 34-kt winds is 4% over five days.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Gulf side; surge risk is confined to the Atlantic coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Additional rainfall around 1 inch possible as outer rain-bands cross the peninsula.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor rip-current risk along nearby Gulf beaches; otherwise none significant for port operations.
